software.leonov.config

Class OptionalConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.config.OptionalConfig

  • public final class OptionalConfig
extends Object
    This class offers users a better way to handle optional properties in the configuration library Typesafe Config. It is a companion to the Typesafe Config's Config class.

    An instance of OptionalConfig is immutable and thread-safe. It can be constructed by passing a Config object to the from(Config) method. The setStrictMode(boolean) determines how this class treats properties with null values.

    Overview:

    Typesafe Config is one of the more popular configuration libraries for JVM languages. Unfortunately it doesn't offer a practical way to handle optional properties. This project is aims to elevate optional properties to a first-class feature by using Java's Optional class to offer a fluent and elegant solution.

    For example: 

     
 final int nthreads = conf.getOptionalInteger("nthreads")
                          .orElse(Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors());
       
 final ExecutorService exec = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(nthreads);

    Please see Optional Config on GitHub and Optional Config's Wiki for further discussion, details, API examples, and FAQ.

    Specifications:

    The table below compares and contrasts this class to the Config class from Typesafe Config. 

     
    
  
    
      MethodProperty valueConfig resultStrict modeOptionalConfig result
  
    
  
    
      getXXXXValid valueReturns the property valueOn/OffReturns the property value
  
    
  
    
      Null valueExceptionOffReturns null
  
    
  
    
      Null valueExceptionOnException
  
    
  
    
      Invalid valueExceptionOn/OffException
  
    
  
    
      Missing propertyExceptionOn/OffException
  
    
  
    
      Missing valueExceptionOn/OffException
  
    
  
    
      getXXXXListValid list (no null values)Returns the list of valuesOn/OffReturns the list of values
  
    
  
    
      Valid list (contains null values)ExceptionOffReturns the list of values (including nulls)
  
    
  
    
      Valid list (contains null values)ExceptionOnException
  
    
  
    
      Null listExceptionOffReturns null
  
    
  
    
      Null listExceptionOnException
  
    
  
    
      Invalid listExceptionOn/OffException
  
    
  
    
      Missing propertyExceptionOn/OffException
  
    
  
    
      Missing valueExceptionOn/OffException
  
    
  
    
      getOptionalXXXXValid valueN/AOn/OffReturns an  Optional containing the value
  
    
  
    
      Null valueN/AOn/OffReturns Optional.empty()
  
    
  
    
      Missing propertyN/AOn/OffReturns Optional.empty()
  
    
  
    
      Invalid valueN/AOn/OffException
  
    
  
    
      Missing valueN/AOn/OffException
  
      
  
    
      getOptionalXXXXListValid list (no null values)N/AOn/OffReturns an Optional containing the list of values
  
    
  
    
      Valid list (contains null values)N/AOffReturns an Optional containing the list of values (including nulls)
  
    
  
    
      Valid list (contains null values)N/AOnException
  
    
  
    
      Null listN/AOn/OffReturns Optional.empty()
  
    
  
    
      Missing propertyN/AOn/OffReturns Optional.empty()
  
    
  
    
      Invalid listN/AOn/OffException
  
    
  
    
      Missing valueN/AOn/OffException
    Note that the Config.getEnumList method is re-implemented as OptionalConfig.getEnumSet method.

    Additional functionality:

    This class offers a handful of additional methods which have no equivalent functionality in the Config class, described below. 

     
    
  
    
      MethodFunctionality
  
    
  
    
      getShort(String)Offering methods which operate on properties referencing  Short values (for completeness).
    These methods behave similarly to their Integer and Long counterparts.    		
  
    
  
    
      getOptionalShort(String)
  
    
  
    
      getShortList(String)
  
    
  
    
      getOptionalShortList(String)
  
    
  
    
      getPath(String)Offering methods which operate on properties referencing  Path values.
    A valid  java.nio.file.Path may refer to an existing file or a directory or may not exist on the filesystem.    		
  
    
  
    
      getOptionalPath(String)
  
    
  
    
      getPathList(String)
  
    
  
    
      getOptionalPathList(String)
  
    
  
    
      getFile(String, LinkOption...)Offering methods which operate on properties referencing  Path values.
    A valid  java.nio.file.Path may refer to an existing file or a directory or may not exist on the filesystem.    		
  
    
  
    
      getOptionalFile(String, LinkOption...)
  
    
  
    
      getFileList(String, LinkOption...)
  
    
  
    
      getOptionalFileList(String, LinkOption...)
  
    
  
    
      getDirectory(String, LinkOption...)Offering methods which operate on properties referencing existing directories.
    These methods will throw exceptions if the referenced directories do not exist on the filesystem.    		
  
    
  
    
      getOptionalDirectory(String, LinkOption...)
  
    
  
    
      getDirectoryList(String, LinkOption...)
  
    
  
    
      getOptionalDirectoryList(String, LinkOption...)
  
    
  
    
      getConfig(String)Offering the capability to get nested configuration objects as a standalone OptionalConfig.
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov

      • getConfig

        public OptionalConfig getConfig(String path)
        Returns an OptionalConfig representing the nested configuration object at the specified path expression.

        For example given the following configuration: 

         {
     child {
         prop1 = abc
         prop2 = true
     }
     
     prop3 = 5
     
     sibling {
         prop4 = xyz
     }
 }
        the call to OptionalConfig.getConfig("child") will return the following nested configuration: 
         {
     prop1 = abc
     prop2 = true
 }
        such that parent.getString("child.prop1").equals(parent.getConfig("child").getString("prop1")).
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        the nested OptionalConfig value at the requested path
        Throws:
        ConfigException.Missing - if property is absent or set to null
        ConfigException.WrongType - if property value does not reference a nested configuration type

      • getOptionalConfig

        public Optional<OptionalConfig> getOptionalConfig(String path)
        Returns an OptionalConfig representing the optional nested configuration object at the specified path expression.

        For example given the following configuration: 

         {
     child {
         prop1 = abc
         prop2 = true
     }
     
     prop3 = 5
     
     sibling {
         prop4 = xyz
     }
 }
        the call to OptionalConfig.getConfig("child") will return the following nested configuration: 
         {
     prop1 = abc
     prop2 = true
 }
        such that parent.getString("child.prop1").equals(parent.getConfig("child").getString("prop1")).
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        an OptionalConfig representing the optional nested configuration object at the specified path
        Throws:
        ConfigException.Missing - if property is absent or set to null
        ConfigException.WrongType - if property value does not reference a nested configuration type

      • setStrictMode

        public OptionalConfig setStrictMode(boolean strictMode)
        Returns a copy of this OptionalConfig with the specified strict-mode setting. When strict-mode is enabled properties set to null are treated as absent for the purpose of getXXXX methods.

        By default strict-mode is enabled.

        Parameters:
        strictMode - the specified strict-mode setting
        Returns:
        a copy of this OptionalConfig with the specified strict-mode setting

      • isStrictMode

        public boolean isStrictMode()
        Returns whether or not strict-mode is enabled. When strict-mode is enabled properties set to null are treated as absent purpose of getXXXX methods.
        Returns:
        whether or not strict-mode is enabled

      • getString

        public String getString(String path)
        Returns a String value for the property at the given path expression or null if the property is set to null and strict-mode is disabled.
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a String value for the property at the given path expression or null if the property is set to null and strict-mode is disabled
        Throws:
        ConfigException.Missing - if the property is missing
        ConfigException.Null - if the property is set to null and strict-mode is enabled

      • getOptionalString

        public Optional<String> getOptionalString(String path)
        Returns a String value for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null. Note that strict-mode has no effect on optional properties.
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a String value for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null

      • getStringList

        public List<String> getStringList(String path)
        Returns a List of String values for the property at the given path expression or null if the property is set to null and strict-mode is disabled. Similarly, if strict-mode is disabled, individual values within the list may be set to null.
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a List of String values for the property at the given path expression or null if the property is set to null and strict-mode is disabled
        Throws:
        ConfigException.Missing - if the property is missing
        ConfigException.Null - if the property is set to null and strict-mode is enabled

      • getOptionalStringList

        public Optional<List<String>> getOptionalStringList(String path)
        Returns a List of String values for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null. Note that strict-mode has no effect on optional properties, but if strict-mode is disabled, individual values within the list may be set to null.
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a List of String values for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null

      • getShort

        public Short getShort(String path)
        Returns a Short value for the property at the given path expression or null if the property is set to null and strict-mode is disabled.
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a Short value for the property at the given path expression or null if the property is set to null and strict-mode is disabled
        Throws:
        ConfigException.Missing - if the property is missing
        ConfigException.Null - if the property is set to null and strict-mode is enabled
        ConfigException.WrongType - if the property value cannot be converted to a Short
        ConfigException.WrongType - if the property value is less than Short.MIN_VALUE or more than Short.MAX_VALUE

      • getOptionalShort

        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a Short value for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null
        Throws:
        ConfigException.WrongType - if the property value cannot be converted to a Short
        ConfigException.WrongType - if the property value is less than Short.MIN_VALUE or more than Short.MAX_VALUE

        Returns:

        ConfigException.WrongType - if the property value cannot be converted to a List of Shorts
        ConfigException.WrongType - if a value in the list value is less than Short.MIN_VALUE or more than Short.MAX_VALUE

Note that strict-mode has no effect on optional properties, but if strict-mode is disabled, individual values within the list may be set to null.

      • getLong

        public Long getLong(String path)
        Returns a Long value for the property at the given path expression or null if the property is set to null and strict-mode is disabled. If the value overflows or underflows Long.MAX_VALUE or Long.MIN_VALUE will be returned respectively.
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a Long value for the property at the given path expression or null if the property is set to null and strict-mode is disabled
        Throws:
        ConfigException.Missing - if the property is missing
        ConfigException.Null - if the property is set to null and strict-mode is enabled
        ConfigException.WrongType - if the property value cannot be converted to a Long

      • getOptionalLong

        public Optional<Long> getOptionalLong(String path)
        Returns a Long value for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null. If the value overflows or underflows Long.MAX_VALUE or Long.MIN_VALUE will be returned respectively. Note that strict-mode has no effect on optional properties.
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a Long value for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null
        Throws:
        ConfigException.WrongType - if the property value cannot be converted to a Long

      • getLongList

        public List<Long> getLongList(String path)
        Returns a List of Long values for the property at the given path expression or null if the property is set to null and strict-mode is disabled. Similarly, if strict-mode is disabled, individual values within the list may be set to null. An overflow or underflow for any value in the list will result in Long.MAX_VALUE or Long.MIN_VALUE respectively.
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a List of Long values for the property at the given path expression or null if the property is set to null and strict-mode is disabled
        Throws:
        ConfigException.Missing - if the property is missing
        ConfigException.Null - if the property is set to null and strict-mode is enabled
        ConfigException.WrongType - if the property value cannot be converted to a List of Longs

      • getOptionalLongList

        public Optional<List<Long>> getOptionalLongList(String path)
        Returns a List of Long values for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null. An overflow or underflow for any value in the list will result in Long.MAX_VALUE or Long.MIN_VALUE respectively. Note that strict-mode has no effect on optional properties, but if strict-mode is disabled, individual values within the list may be set to null.
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a List of Long values for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null
        Throws:
        ConfigException.WrongType - if the property value cannot be converted to a List of Longs

        public Optional<List<Double>> getOptionalDoubleList(String path)
        Returns a List of Double values for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null. Note that strict-mode has no effect on optional properties, but if strict-mode is disabled, individual values within the list may be set to null.
        Parameters:
        path - the path expression
        Returns:
        a List of Double values for the optional property at the given path expression or an empty Optional instance if the property is absent or set to null
        Throws:
        ConfigException.WrongType - if the property value cannot be converted to a List of Doubles
